Product Id: The definition of a census farm changed multiple times since 1921. These changes may affect the comparability of data among censuses. For a summary of these changes, refer to <a href=https://www12.statcan.gc.ca/census-recensement/2021/ref/dict/az/Definition-eng.cfm?ID=pop012">Dictionary
Data for Newfoundland are not included in the Canada figures for the 1921, 1931 and 1941 Censuses of Agriculture since Newfoundland did not join Canada until 1949.
Comparability among censuses prior to 1996 and those after is affected by a change in census date from the first week of June to mid-May when a lower percentage of calvings would have occurred.
In 1976, the number of Beef cows" was obtained by subtracting "Cows milking or to be milked" from "Total cows." As a result
CANSIM Id: the size of the dairy herd was understated and the size of the beef herd was overstated because dairy farmers did not always report dry dairy cows under "Cows milking or to be milked." Since 1981
URL: when a separate question on the number of "beef cows" was introduced
Cube Notes: the reporting of both dairy and beef cows has improved."

Product Id: Due to response errors in 1996, the number of Dairy cows" and the number of farms reporting dairy cows may have been overstated
CANSIM Id: whereas the number of "Beef cows" and the number of farms reporting beef cows may have been understated. The total number of cattle and calves
Cube Notes: was not affected. These errors limit the comparability of the data between 1996 and the other census years. Response errors were more prevalent in provinces with a low proportion of dairy operations."

Product Id: In 1976 and 1981 rams were included with Ewes and wethers." In 1986 and 1996 "Rams" were reported separately while wethers were included with "Ewes." In 1991 and 2001 "Rams" and "Ewes" were reported separately while "All other sheep and lambs" included wethers. Since 2006
Due to conceptual changes, 2011 data are not comparable with previous censuses: 2011 data includes breeding stock only, whereas earlier data includes all mink.
On March 6, 2013, Statistics Canada corrected other pigs" that were released on December 10
CANSIM Id: 2012. This correction pertains to double counting of the components making up this variable. This does not affect any related variables in this table."
